intro: Echium trichotomum, commonly known as the three-branched viper's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
